definition: to meet by chance (usually with misfortune)/classifier for events: time, turn, incident
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Thus attacked, the Japanese would be afraid to split up.
sentences.chinese: 一遭到這樣的伏擊，日軍就龜縮作一因。

sentences.english: The animals were ruthlessly hunted to the verge of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 這些動物由於遭到無情的捕獵而瀕於滅絕。

sentences.english: The hawkish Cho believed the Separatists had attacked Glid Station.
sentences.chinese: 強硬的喬相信格利德站遭到了分裂分子的進攻。

sentences.english: He CNNs his old friends for not lending money to him.
sentences.chinese: 老朋友們因爲不願意借錢給他而遭到他無恥地辱罵。

sentences.english: Japanese-Americans were rounded up and interned during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 第二次世界大戰期間，日本裔美國人遭到集體關押。

sentences.english: He arrived boos at a federal courthouse in Richmond, Virginia.
sentences.chinese: 他在維吉尼亞理德曼的聯邦法院遭到了陣陣噓聲。

sentences.english: We have been struck by lightning, the rear fuselage damaged, right elevator lost.
sentences.chinese: 我們遭到雷擊，後機身被打壞，失去右升降舵。

sentences.english: Similar proposals have failed in New York and Philadelphia .
sentences.chinese: 類似的提案在紐約和費城遭到否決。

sentences.english: Some officials kept silent because they were afraid of being persecuted by Zhao Gao.
sentences.chinese: 有的大臣害怕遭到趙高的迫害，於是保持沉默。

sentences.english: He got the sack for petty thieving.
sentences.chinese: 他因小偷小摸遭到了解僱。

sentences.english: Michael Vick is being indicted again for staging dogfights.
sentences.chinese: 邁克爾Vick由於籌劃鬥狗再次遭到起訴。

sentences.english: The legislation, now under review, immediately came under heavy fire.
sentences.chinese: 目前正在審議的該法立即遭到大量的口誅筆伐。

sentences.english: Even so, Kaifeng Jews say they weren't singled out for discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，開封猶太人說他們並沒有遭到歧視對待。
那項建議當即遭到拒絕。

sentences.english: Witnesses said the bomb hit the refugees as they were sheltering under trees and bushes.
sentences.chinese: 目擊者稱，難民在樹林和樹叢中避難時遭到炸彈襲擊。

sentences.english: There are unconfirmed reports that the two people have been shot in the neighboring town.
sentences.chinese: 未經證實的報道說在附近城鎮有兩個人遭到槍殺。

definition: to meet by chance (usually with misfortune)/classifier for events: time, turn, incident
to receive (praise, an education, punishment etc)/to be ...ed (praised, educated, punished etc)

quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
to recruit (followers)/to scout for (talent etc)/to incur/to lead to
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to endure/to suffer/to be subjected to
